sentences.sentence: The Town Mouse and the Country Mouse
A town mouse and a country mouse were friends.
One day, the country mouse invited his friend to come and see him at his home in the fields.
The town mouse came, and they sat down to eat.
The simple meal of corn and roots( 根 ) was not to the taste( 不合口味 ) of the guest, and he said,
“My poor dear friend, you live here no better than the ants.
Now, you should just see how I live!
There is so much great food in my house.
You must come and stay with me, and I promise you shall eat well.”
So when he returned to town, he took the country mouse with him.
The town mouse lived in a little hole next to the kitchen, and the two mice enjoyed the most delicious meat, cheese( 奶酪 ), and pies.
The country mouse had never seen anything like it.
But then the cook came in, chased( 追赶 ) them all around the kitchen with a broom( 扫把 ), and nearly killed them.
The two mice finally ran off( 逃跑 ) and hid in a small and uncomfortable hole.
Soon, when all was quiet, they went out again and again started to eat the delicious food,
only to look over their shoulders and see an enormous( 巨大的 ) cat getting ready to kill and eat them!
So once again they had to run for their lives, and only just escaped( 逃离 ).
This was too much for the visitor.
“Good-bye,” he said, “I'm leaving. I can see you live in a great place, but there is too much danger.
At home my meals may be simple, but at least I can enjoy my simple dinner of roots( 根 ) and corn in peace.”
MORAL: East, West, Home's Best.
The Traveler and His Dog
A traveler was about to start on a journey when he saw his dog standing at the door waiting.
He asked him, “Why do you stand there? Everything is ready except you. Come with me now!”
The dog, shaking his tail, replied,
“Oh, master( 主人 )! I am quite ready.
I am waiting for you.”
MORAL: The lazy often blame( 归咎于 ) delay( 拖延 ) on their more active friend.
The Travelers and the Ax( 斧头 )
Two men were traveling along the same road when one of them picked up( 捡起 ) an ax( 斧头 ) and said, “Look what I’ve found!”
“Don’t say I,” replied the other;
“instead, say: look what we have found.”
Some time later, the man who had lost the ax( 斧头 ) appeared and claimed that the man who found it had stolen it.
“Oh dear,” the man who found the ax( 斧头 ) said to his companion( 同伴 ), “now we are in trouble.”
“Don’t say we,” the other replied;
“instead, say: I am in trouble!”
MORAL: If you don't let others share the prize, you cannot expect them to share the danger.
The Travelers and the Tree
Two travelers, tired by the heat of the summer sun, lay down under a tree.
As they rested under it, one of the travelers said to the other,
“This is a useless tree. It has no fruit, and so has no use to man.”
The tree then said, “You ungrateful( 忘恩负义的 ) men! You say I’m useless while resting under me to hide from( 遮挡 ) the sun!”
MORAL: People are not grateful( 感激的 ) for things that are free.
The Trumpeter( 号兵 ) Taken Prisoner( 俘虏 )
A trumpeter( 号兵 ), during a battle, went too near the enemy, and was caught by them.
They were about to kill him when he begged( 乞求 ) them to listen to him.
“I do not fight,” he said; “and I carry no weapons( 武器 ).
I only blow this trumpet( 小号 ), and I surely cannot hurt you.
Why should you kill me?”
“You may not fight yourself,” said the others;
“but you encourage your men to fight.”
MORAL: Words may be actions.

article_info.previous: 在昨天的故事中，男孩小时候偷了同学的东西，妈妈非但没有责骂他反而鼓励男孩。他长大后，因偷窃罪入狱的时候，妈妈追悔莫及。这个故事告诫我们要把罪恶消灭在萌芽中。
article_info.share_words: East, West, Home's Best.  If you don't let others share the prize, you cannot expect them to share the danger.

question.cn: 在故事The Town Mouse and the Country Mouse中，乡村老鼠的食物是什么？
question.en: In the story The Town Mouse and the Country Mouse, what was the country mouse's meal?

analysis: 文中农村的老鼠邀请城镇的老鼠去他家作客的时候提到：“The simple meal of corn and roots was not to the taste of the guest.”由此可知答案选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Traveler and His Dog中，狗为什么要站在门口？
question.en: In the story The Traveler and His Dog, why did the dog stand at the door?

options.en: He was waiting for his master.
He didn't want to go out.
He was waiting for another dog.

analysis: 文中提到：“Oh, master! I am quite ready. I am waiting for you.”可知，狗站在门口是在等待自己的主人，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Travels and the Ax中，旅行者们是否偷了那把斧头？
question.en: In the story The Travelers and the Ax, did the travelers really steal the ax?

analysis: 文中提到：“Two men were traveling along the same road when one of them picked up an ax and said.”可知，旅行者是捡到的斧子，并不是偷来的，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Travelers and the Tree中，其中一个旅行者为什么会认为树没有用呢？
question.en: In the story The Travelers and the Tree, why did one of the travelers think the tree was useless?

analysis: 文中提到：“One of the travelers said to the other, ‘this is a useless tree. It has no fruit, and so has no use to man.’”可知，因为树上面没有结果实，所以旅行者认为他是无用的，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Trumpeter Taken Prisoner中，为什么没有武器的号手被杀了？
question.en: In the story the Trumpeter Taken Prisoner, why was the trumpeter killed even if he carried no weapon?

options.en: Because the enemies were too cruel.

options.cn: 因为他鼓励自己的士兵战斗。
options.en: Because he encouraged his men to fight.

options.cn: 因为他的小号看起来像个武器。
options.en: Because his trumpet looked like a weapon.

analysis: 文中提到：“‘You might not fight yourself,’ said the others; ‘but you encourage your men to fight.’”可知，号手吹号鼓励士兵战斗，因此选B。
